bibl.title: Dispatch from Robert S. Newton to John L. Cadwalader
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml files, review, and addition encoding

div1.opener:
No.119
United States Commercial Agency
St Paul de Loanda
div1.p:
Abstract of contents.
Advising that the National flags of this Agency are very much worn and requesting new ones. Suggesting sending per. Yates & Porterfields ships to Gaboon, thence to Loanda per Steamer.

div1.opener:
No. 119.
United States Commercial Agency
St. Paul de Loanda 12th Dec. 1876 To the Assistant Secretary of State Washington, D.C.
div1.p:
Sir,
I have the honor to request the Department the favor to send to the Commercial Agency two National flags, of a large size say 13 ft. by 10 ft.

As it is customary here to hoist all consulate flags on Sundays and all public hollidays those now in use at this Agency are considerably worn. A large flag is necessary on account of the height of the flag staff at my residence Messrs
Messrs. Yates and Porterfield of New York have often vessels to Gaboon which would be a good way to send them as there are two steamers a month from that port to this

closer.salute:
I have the honor to be
Your most obedient Servant
closer.signed:
Robt S. Newton
Vice Commercial Agent
